00001 /* MC-simple.cpp: Simple memory controller */
00002 /*
00003  * __COPYRIGHT__ GT
00004  */
00005 
00006 #define COMPONENT_NAME "simple"
00007 
00008 #ifdef MC_PARSE_ARGS
00009 if(!strcasecmp(COMPONENT_NAME,type))
00010 {
00011   int RQ_size;
00012   int FIFO;
00013            
00014   if(sscanf(opt_string,"%*[^:]:%d:%d",&RQ_size,&FIFO) != 2)
00015     fatal("bad memory controller options string %s (should be \"simple:RQ-size:FIFO\")",opt_string);
00016   return new MC_simple_t(RQ_size,FIFO);
00017 }
00018 #else
00019 
00020 /* This implements a very simple queue of memory requests.
00021    Requests are enqueued and dequeued in FIFO order, but the
00022    MC scans the requests to try to batch requests to the
00023    same page together to avoid frequent opening/closing of
00024    pages (or set the flag to force FIFO request scheduling). */
00025 class MC_simple_t:public MC_t
00026 {
00027   protected:
00028   int RQ_size;        /* size of request queue, i.e. maximum number of outstanding requests */
00029   int RQ_num;         /* current number of requests */
00030   int RQ_head;        /* next transaction to send back to the cpu(s) */
00031   int RQ_req_head;    /* next transaction to send to DRAM */
00032   int RQ_tail;
00033   struct MC_action_t * RQ;
00034 
00035   bool FIFO_scheduling;
00036   md_paddr_t last_request;
00037   tick_t next_available_time;
00038 
00039   public:
00040 
00041   MC_simple_t(const int arg_RQ_size, const int arg_FIFO):
00042               RQ_num(0), RQ_head(0), RQ_req_head(0), RQ_tail(0), last_request(0), next_available_time(0)
00043   {
00044     init();
00045 
00046     RQ_size = arg_RQ_size;
00047     FIFO_scheduling = arg_FIFO;
00048     RQ = (struct MC_action_t*) calloc(RQ_size,sizeof(*RQ));
00049     if(!RQ)
00050       fatal("failed to calloc memory controller request queue");
00051   }
00052 
00053   ~MC_simple_t()
00054   {
00055     free(RQ); RQ = NULL;
00056   }
00057 
00058   MC_ENQUEUABLE_HEADER
00059   {
00060     return RQ_num < RQ_size;
00061   }
00062 
00063   /* Enqueue a memory command (read/write) to the memory controller. */
00064   MC_ENQUEUE_HEADER
00065   {
00066     fprintf(stdout,"\n[%lld]MC enqueue %llx cmd %d ",sim_cycle, addr, cmd );
00067 
00068     MC_assert(RQ_num < RQ_size,(void)0);
00069 
00070     struct MC_action_t * req = &RQ[RQ_tail];
00071 
00072     MC_assert(req->valid == false,(void)0);
00073     req->valid = true;
00074     req->prev_cp = prev_cp;
00075     req->cmd = cmd;
00076     req->addr = addr;
00077     req->linesize = linesize;
00078     req->op = op;
00079     req->action_id = action_id;
00080     req->MSHR_bank = MSHR_bank;
00081     req->MSHR_index = MSHR_index;
00082     req->cb = cb;
00083     req->get_action_id = get_action_id;
00084     req->when_enqueued = sim_cycle;
00085     req->when_started = TICK_T_MAX;
00086     req->when_finished = TICK_T_MAX;
00087     req->when_returned = TICK_T_MAX;
00088 
00089     RQ_num++;
00090     RQ_tail = modinc(RQ_tail,RQ_size); //(RQ_tail + 1) % RQ_size;
00091     total_accesses++;
00092   }
00093 
00094   /* This is called each cycle to process the requests in the memory controller queue. */
00095   MC_STEP_HEADER
00096   {
00097     struct MC_action_t * req;
00098 
00099     /* MC runs at FSB speed */
00100     //if(sim_cycle % uncore->fsb->ratio)
00101       //return;
00102 
00103     if(RQ_num > 0) /* are there any requests at all? */
00104     {
00105       /* see if there's a new request to send to DRAM */
00106       if(next_available_time <= sim_cycle)
00107       {
00108         int req_index = -1;
00109         md_paddr_t req_page = (md_paddr_t)-1;
00110 
00111         /* try to find a request to the same page as we're currently accessing */
00112         int idx = RQ_head;
00113         for(int i=0;i<RQ_num;i++)
00114         {
00115           req = &RQ[idx];
00116           MC_assert(req->valid,(void)0);
00117 
00118           if(req->when_started == TICK_T_MAX)
00119           {
00120             if(req_index == -1) /* don't have a request yet */
00121             {
00122               req_index = idx;
00123               req_page = req->addr >> PAGE_SHIFT;
00124               if(FIFO_scheduling || (req_page == last_request)) /* using FIFO, or this is access to same page as current access */
00125                 break;
00126             }
00127             if((req->addr >> PAGE_SHIFT) == last_request) /* found an access to same page as current access */
00128             {
00129               req_index = idx;
00130               req_page = req->addr >> PAGE_SHIFT;
00131               break;
00132             }
00133           }
00134           idx = modinc(idx,RQ_size);
00135         }
00136 
00137         if(req_index != -1)
00138         {
00139           req = &RQ[req_index];
00140           req->when_started = sim_cycle;
00141           req->when_finished = sim_cycle + dram->access(req->cmd, req->addr, req->linesize);
00142           last_request = req_page;
00143           next_available_time = sim_cycle + uncore->fsb->ratio;
00144           total_dram_cycles += req->when_finished - req->when_started;
00145         }
00146       }
00147 
00148       /* walk request queue and process requests that have completed. */
00149       int idx = RQ_head;
00150       for(int i=0;i<RQ_num;i++)
00151       {
00152         req = &RQ[idx];
00153 
00154         if((req->when_finished <= sim_cycle) && (req->when_returned == TICK_T_MAX) && (!req->prev_cp || bus_free(uncore->fsb)))
00155         {
00156           req->when_returned = sim_cycle;
00157 
00158           total_service_cycles += sim_cycle - req->when_enqueued;
00159 
00160           /* fill previous level as appropriate */
00161           if(req->prev_cp)
00162           {
00163             fill_arrived(req->prev_cp,req->MSHR_bank,req->MSHR_index);
00164             bus_use(uncore->fsb,req->linesize>>uncore->fsb_DDR,req->cmd==CACHE_PREFETCH);
00165             break; /* might as well break, since only one request can writeback per cycle */
00166           }
00167         }
00168         idx = modinc(idx,RQ_size);
00169       }
00170 
00171       /* attempt to "commit" the head */
00172       req = &RQ[RQ_head];
00173       if(req->valid)
00174       {
00175         if(req->when_returned <= sim_cycle)
00176         {
00177           req->valid = false;
00178           RQ_num--;
00179           MC_assert(RQ_num >= 0,(void)0);
00180           RQ_head = modinc(RQ_head,RQ_size); //(RQ_head + 1) % RQ_size;
00181         }
00182       }
00183     }
00184   }
00185 
00186   MC_PRINT_HEADER
00187   {
00188     fprintf(stderr,"<<<<< MC >>>>>\n");
00189     for(int i=0;i<RQ_size;i++)
00190     {
00191       fprintf(stderr,"MC[%d]: ",i);
00192       if(RQ[i].valid)
00193       {
00194         if(RQ[i].op)
00195           fprintf(stderr,"%p(%lld)",RQ[i].op,((struct uop_t*)RQ[i].op)->decode.uop_seq);
00196         fprintf(stderr," --> %s",RQ[i].prev_cp->name);
00197         fprintf(stderr," MSHR[%d][%d]",RQ[i].MSHR_bank,RQ[i].MSHR_index);
00198       }
00199       else
00200         fprintf(stderr,"---");
00201       fprintf(stderr,"\n");
00202     }
00203   }
00204 
00205 };
00206 
00207 
00208 #endif /* MC_PARSE_ARGS */
